# Introduction

This site will include supplemental material to our regular macroeconomics course readings. 

```{r setup, include=FALSE}
options(repos = "http://lib.stat.cmu.edu/R/CRAN/")

# Code to automatically pull in and install missing packages
list.of.packages <- c("readr","tidyverse","lubridate","reshape2","dplyr","tidyquant", "zoo","RCurl", "quantmod","wbstats","usmap","gtrendsR","tmap","spData","pwt9","googleVis")
new.packages <- list.of.packages[!(list.of.packages %in% installed.packages()[,"Package"])]
if(length(new.packages)) install.packages(new.packages)
```


```{r, include = FALSE}
library(readr)
library(quantmod)
library(zoo)
library(tidyquant)
library(tidyverse)
library(lubridate)
library(reshape2)
library(dplyr)
library(wbstats)
library(ggplot2)
library(usmap)
library(gtrendsR)
library(tmap)
library(spData)
library(pwt9)
library(googleVis)

```


	
```{r}
unems <- wb(country = c("BRA","IND","MEX"),
               indicator = c("SL.UEM.TOTL.ZS"), mrv=30, gapfill=TRUE, POSIXct = TRUE)

ggplot(unems, aes(x = date_ct, y = value, color = iso2c)) + 
  geom_line(size = 1) +
  labs(title = "Brazil, Mexico & India Unemployment", x = "Date", y = "Percent", color = "Country") + 
  theme_classic()


```
